title: New Heaven and New Earth
shortSummary: Revelation 21 reveals the vision of the new heaven and new earth, where God dwells with His people in the holy city, the New Jerusalem. This chapter offers a powerful promise of eternal restoration, the end of suffering, and the perfect union between God and redeemed humanity.
timeline: c. AD 95 - Revelation written during the apostolic era

keyCharacters.name: John
keyCharacters.description: The apostle and author of Revelation who receives and records the vision of the new heaven, new earth, and New Jerusalem.

keyCharacters.name: The Lamb
keyCharacters.description: Jesus Christ, depicted as the Lamb, whose bride is the New Jerusalem and who is the light and temple of the city.

keyCharacters.name: One of the Seven Angels
keyCharacters.description: An angel who guides John in the vision, showing him the bride, the Lamb’s wife, and measuring the holy city.

definitions.definition: The holy city descending from heaven, symbolizing the eternal dwelling place of God with His redeemed people.
Titles of God meaning the beginning and the end, emphasizing His eternal nature and sovereign authority.
The eternal separation from God, described as the lake of fire, reserved for the fearful, unbelieving, and sinful.

definitions.term: Fountain of the Water of Life
definitions.definition: A metaphor for the eternal life and spiritual satisfaction freely given by God to those who thirst for Him.

outline.heading: The New Creation and God’s Presence
outline.description: John sees a new heaven and new earth where the old order has passed away, and God promises to make all things new, wiping away every tear and ending death and sorrow.

outline.heading: God’s Promise to the Overcomer and the Warning
outline.description: God declares Himself the Alpha and Omega and offers the water of life freely to those who thirst; He also warns of the eternal judgment awaiting the unrepentant.

outline.heading: The Vision of the New Jerusalem
outline.description: An angel shows John the holy city, described with magnificent imagery of precious stones, gates of pearl, and pure gold, symbolizing the glory and perfection of God’s eternal kingdom.

outline.heading: The Glory and Security of the New Jerusalem
outline.description: The city has no temple because God and the Lamb are its temple; it needs no sun or moon as God’s glory illuminates it, and only those written in the Lamb’s book of life may enter.

application: Trust in God’s promise of a new creation where suffering and death will be no more, strengthening hope in eternal life.
Seek to overcome sin and remain faithful to Christ, knowing that the reward is to be called God’s child and inherit all things.
Live a life pleasing to God, avoiding the sins that lead to the second death, and be assured of your name in the Lamb’s book of life.
Find comfort and assurance that God dwells with His people and that His presence is the ultimate source of light and joy.

keyVerses.text: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.
keyVerses.significance: This verse powerfully assures believers of the end of all suffering and the comforting presence of God in eternity.

keyVerses.text: And he said unto me, It is done. I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end. I will give unto him that is athirst of the fountain of the water of life freely.
keyVerses.significance: It reveals God’s sovereign completion of His redemptive work and the free gift of eternal life to all who seek Him.

keyVerses.text: And I saw no temple therein: for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are the temple of it.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the intimate presence of God and Christ as the very temple, highlighting the perfect fellowship with God in the new creation.
